genocode package¶

Submodules¶

Data Extraction¶

This file contains functions for data extraction, conversion, and cleaning

genocode.data_extract.txt_to_csv(txt_filepath, csv_filepath)¶

converts a .txt data file to a .csv data file and cleans the formatting :param txt_filepath: The .txt file to be converted :type txt_filepath: required :param csv_filepath: The .csv output data to be written :type csv_filepath: required

Returns

A pandas DataFrame.

Return type

pandas.core.frame.DataFrame

Data Visualization¶

This file contains functions which can be used to visualize the graphical representation of the statistical data generated by DTC genetic tests. It gives a better understanding of the risk of genotypes posed by the phenotypes in a person.

genocode.datavis.ci_to_sd(lowerci, upperci, cival=95.0, size=100)¶

Converts Confidence interval to Mean and Standard deviation. :param lowerci: The lower bound of the confidence

interval.

Parameters

  • upperci (float, required) – The upper bound of the confidence interval.

  • cival (float, optional) – The confidence level. It must be one of the following values. [99.9,99.5,99.0,95.0,90.0,85.0,80.0] The default value is 95 for 95% confidence interval.

  • size (int, optional) – The size of the sample to be generated. The default value is 100.

Returns

A float value for Standard deviation.

Return type

float

genocode.datavis.compounddata(mean1=None, sdev1=None, serror1=None, upperci1=None, lowerci1=None, cival1=95.0, mean2=None, sdev2=None, serror2=None, upperci2=None, lowerci2=None, cival2=95.0, mean3=None, sdev3=None, serror3=None, upperci3=None, lowerci3=None, cival3=95.0, size=1000)¶

A partial wrapper function to generate three datasets of similar attributes. :param mean1: The mean. :type mean1: int/float, optional :param sdev1, sdev2, sdev3: The standard

deviation of the data to be generated.

Parameters

  • serror2, serror3 (serror1,) – The standard error of the data to be generated.

  • lowerci2, lowerci3 (lowerci1,) – The lower bound of the confidence interval.

  • upperci2, upperci3 (upperci1,) – The upper bound of the confidence interval.

  • cival1 (float, optional) – The upper bound of the confidence interval.

Returns

A numpy array with random standard distribution

data.

numpy.ndarray: A numpy array with random standard distribution

data.

numpy.ndarray: A numpy array with random standard distribution

data.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

genocode.datavis.correctdatatype(mean=None, sdev=None, serror=None, upperci=None, lowerci=None)¶

Returns float values for each statistical parameter. :param mean: The mean. :type mean: int, optional :param sdev: The standard deviation of the data to be

generated.

Parameters

  • serror (int, optional) – The standard error of the data to be generated.

  • lowerci (int, required) – The lower bound of the confidence interval.

  • upperci (int, required) – The upper bound of the confidence interval.

Returns

A float value for mean. float: A float value for sd. float: A float value for se. float: A float value for lowerci. float: A float value for upperci.

Return type

float

genocode.datavis.databinning(datagenerated1, datagenerated2, datagenerated3, bins_list)¶

A function to create 3 histogram bins. :param datagenerated1: A numpy array with

random standard distribution data.

Parameters

  • datagenerated2 (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

  • datagenerated3 (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

  • bins_list (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array listing the edges of the bins.

Returns

The values of first histograms. numpy.ndarray: The values of second histograms. numpy.ndarray: The values of third histograms.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

genocode.datavis.datagen(mean=None, sdev=None, serror=None, lowerci=None, upperci=None, cival=95.0, size=100)¶

Generates random standard distribution data from mean and standard deviation. :param mean: The mean of the data to be generated. :type mean: float, required :param sdev: The standard deviation of the data to be

generated.

Parameters

  • serror (float, optional) – The standard error of the data to be generated.

  • lowerci (float, required) – The lower bound of the confidence interval.

  • upperci (float, required) – The upper bound of the confidence interval.

  • cival (float, optional) – The confidence level. It must be one of the following values. [99.9,99.5,99.0,95.0,90.0,85.0,80.0] The default value is 95 for 95% confidence interval.

  • size (int, optional) – The size of the sample to be generated. The default value is 100.

Returns

A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

genocode.datavis.histplotting(datagenerated1, datagenerated2, datagenerated3, bins_list=None)¶

A function to plot 3 overlapping histograms :param datagenerated1: A numpy array with

random standard distribution data.

Parameters

  • datagenerated2 (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

  • datagenerated3 (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

  • bins_list (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array listing the edges of the bins.

Returns

None.

genocode.datavis.pdfgen(mean1, sdev1, mean2, sdev2, mean3, sdev3, bins_list)¶

A function to generate 3 probability density function data :param mean1: The mean of the first dataset. :type mean1: float, required :param mean2: The mean of the second dataset. :type mean2: float, required :param mean3: The mean of the third dataset. :type mean3: float, required :param sdev1: The standard deviation of the first

dataset

Parameters

  • sdev2 (float, required) – The standard deviation of the second dataset

  • sdev3 (float, required) – The standard deviation of the third dataset

  • bins_list (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array listing the edges of the bins.

Returns

None.

genocode.datavis.pdfplotting(mean1, sdev1, mean2, sdev2, mean3, sdev3, bins_list)¶

A function to plot 3 overlapping probability density function curves. :param datagenerated1: A numpy array with

random standard distribution data.

Parameters

  • datagenerated2 (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

  • datagenerated3 (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

  • bins_list (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array listing the edges of the bins.

Returns

None.

genocode.datavis.percent_overlap(mean1=None, sdev1=None, mean2=None, sdev2=None, mean3=None, sdev3=None)¶

A function to estimate the percentage of overlap between multiple normally distributed data. :param mean1: The mean of the first data set. :type mean1: float, required :param mean2: The mean of the second data set. :type mean2: float, required :param mean3: The mean of the third data set. :type mean3: float, required :param sdev1: The standard deviation of the first :type sdev1: float, required :param sdev2: The standard deviation of the second

data set.

Parameters

sdev3 (float, required) – The standard deviation of the third data set.

Returns

A float value showing the percentage overlap

between 1st and 2nd data sets.

numpy.float64: A float value showing the percentage overlap

between 1st and 3rd data sets.

numpy.float64: A float value showing the percentage overlap

between 2nd and 3rd data sets.

Return type

numpy.float64

genocode.datavis.se_to_sd(serror, size)¶

Converts Standard Error to Standard deviation. :param serror: The standard error of the data to be

generated.

Parameters

size (float, required) – The size of the population.

Returns

A float value for the standard deviation.

Return type

float

genocode.datavis.violinplotting(datagenerated1, datagenerated2, datagenerated3)¶

A function to plot 3 consecutive violin plots :param datagenerated1: A numpy array with

random standard distribution data.

Parameters

  • datagenerated2 (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

  • datagenerated3 (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

  • bins_list (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array listing the edges of the bins.

Returns

None.

Vectorized Data Visualization¶

This file contains vectorized functions which can be used to visualize the graphical representation of the statistical data generated by DTC genetic tests. It gives a better understanding of the risk of genotypes posed by the phenotypes in a person.

genocode.vectorized_datavis.ci_to_sd(lowerci, upperci, cival=95.0, size=100)¶

Converts Confidence interval to Mean and Standard deviation. :param lowerci: The lower bound of the confidence

interval.

Parameters

  • upperci (float, required) – The upper bound of the confidence interval.

  • cival (float, optional) – The confidence level. It must be one of the following values. [99.9,99.5,99.0,95.0,90.0,85.0,80.0] The default value is 95 for 95% confidence interval.

  • size (int, optional) – The size of the sample to be generated. The default value is 100.

Returns

A float value for Standard deviation.

Return type

float

genocode.vectorized_datavis.compounddata(mean=None, sdev=None, serror=None, upperci=None, lowerci=None, cival=95.0, size=1000)¶

A partial wrapper function to generate three datasets of similar attributes. :param mean: The means. :type mean: numpy.ndarray, optional :param sdev: The standard deviations of the

data to be generated.

Parameters

  • serror (numpy.ndarray, optional) – The standard error of the data to be generated.

  • lowerci (numpy.ndarray, optional) – The lower bounds of the confidence interval.

  • upperci (numpy.ndarray, optional) – The upper bounds of the confidence interval.

  • cival (float, optional) – The confidence level.

Returns

A numpy array with all the random standard

distribution data.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

genocode.vectorized_datavis.correctdatatype(mean=None, sdev=None, serror=None, upperci=None, lowerci=None)¶

Returns float values for each statistical parameter. :param mean: The mean. :type mean: int/str, optional :param sdev: The standard deviation of the data to be

generated.

Parameters

  • serror (int/str, optional) – The standard error of the data to be generated.

  • lowerci (int/str, required) – The lower bound of the confidence interval.

  • upperci (int/str, required) – The upper bound of the confidence interval.

Returns

A float value for mean. float: A float value for sd. float: A float value for se. float: A float value for lowerci. float: A float value for upperci.

Return type

float

genocode.vectorized_datavis.databinning(datagenerated, bins_list)¶

A function to create 3 histogram bins. :param datagenerated: A numpy array with

random standard distribution data.

Parameters

bins_list (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array listing the edges of the bins.

Returns

The values of all the histograms.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

genocode.vectorized_datavis.datagen(mean=None, sdev=None, serror=None, lowerci=None, upperci=None, cival=95.0, size=100)¶

Generates random standard distribution data from mean and standard deviation. :param mean: The mean of the data to be generated. :type mean: float, required :param sdev: The standard deviation of the data to be

generated.

Parameters

  • serror (float, optional) – The standard error of the data to be generated.

  • lowerci (float, required) – The lower bound of the confidence interval.

  • upperci (float, required) – The upper bound of the confidence interval.

  • cival (float, optional) – The confidence level. It must be one of the following values. [99.9,99.5,99.0,95.0,90.0,85.0,80.0] The default value is 95 for 95% confidence interval.

  • size (int, optional) – The size of the sample to be generated. The default value is 100.

Returns

A numpy array with random standard distribution data.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

genocode.vectorized_datavis.histplotting(datagenerated, bins_list=None)¶

A function to plot 3 overlapping histograms :param datagenerated: A numpy array with

random standard distribution data.

Parameters

bins_list (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array listing the edges of the bins.

Returns

None.

genocode.vectorized_datavis.pdfgen(mean, sdev, bins_list)¶

A function to generate 3 probability density function data :param mean1: The means of the datasets. :type mean1: numpy.ndarray, required :param sdev1: The standard deviation of

the dataset

Parameters

bins_list (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array listing the edges of the bins.

Returns

None.

genocode.vectorized_datavis.pdfplotting(mean, sdev, bins_list)¶

A function to plot 3 overlapping probability density function curves. :param datagenerated: A numpy array with

random standard distribution data.

Parameters

bins_list (numpy.ndarray, required) – A numpy array listing the edges of the bins.

Returns

None.

genocode.vectorized_datavis.percent_overlap(mean=None, sdev=None)¶

A function to estimate the percentage of overlap between multiple normally distributed data. :param mean: The means of the data sets. :type mean: numpy.ndarray, required :param sdev1: The standard deviations of

the data sets.

Returns

An array with float values showing the

percentage overlap between 1st and the other data sets.

Return type

numpy.ndarray

genocode.vectorized_datavis.se_to_sd(serror, size)¶

Converts Standard Error to Standard deviation. :param serror: The standard error of the data to be

generated.

Parameters

size (float, required) – The size of the population.

Returns

A float value for the standard deviation.

Return type

float
